title: Lewis Hamilton all but certain to end career at Mercedes, Toto Wolf hints
text:
Lewis Hamilton is all but certain to end his career at Mercedes, with team principal Toto Wolff giving his strongest indication yet that the five-time world champion would spurn a move to Ferrari in favour of signing a final contract at the Silver Arrows.

While Hamilton has a £40 million-a-year deal that keeps him a Mercedes driver until the end of next year, the prospect of radical regulation changes in 2021 – plus a strict budget cap that would limit all teams to a maximum £125 million annual spend – has raised the temptation of a final chapter at Maranello. Even Wolff has acknowledged this season that the allure of Ferrari’s unrivalled history in the sport could prove irresistible, joking: “Everyone has the desire to go with the redhead.”​

But here in Mexico City, where Hamilton has the opportunity on Sunday to seal his sixth world title, Wolff appeared to scotch the Ferrari links altogether. “I think that this Ferrari thing has maybe been blown out of proportion,” he said. “Lewis has a clear opinion on where he sees himself in future, and we are, and have always been, very loyal to our drivers. In 2021, everything is different, but ultimately the cars’ performance is what counts most for the top guys. These discussions have slowly but surely started.”​
